title: Instalocking in Norms
body:
I'll cut right to the chase. Generally, instalocking seems to be frowned upon and seen by most people to be a toxic approach to the team. In this recent episode of /ALL Chat, they're flat out encouraging people to just instalock Ekko because he's out. 

What do you think? Calls take preference, or instalocking? Toxic or no?

replies.body: Just trash ekko and it'll go back to normal
There is really no other way to play new champs.

The reality is that instalocking is 2000% more frequent during the 1-2 weeks after a champ is released regardless of what /ALL chat does or does not encourage (I don't even know what it is, never read/ listened/ watched it). It's frustrating, but it's also generally accepted that (with grim resignation that every single queue from bots to normals is a race to pick the new champ before someone else does.

It's impossible to argue (constructively) with an instalock, regardless of whether it's right or wrong.
They are encouraging them to instalock ekko (any role) i assume.
nerf dat zhit and itz gonna fine for zure
